api_url.description: API URL for your SignalFx org, may include a realm

custom_app_url.description: Application URL for your SignalFx org, often customzied for organizations using SSO

timeout_seconds.description: Timeout duration for a single HTTP call in seconds. Defaults to 120

detectors.description: detectors to which this muting rule applies

start_time.description: starting time of an alert muting rule as a Unix timestamp, in seconds

stop_time.description: stop time of an alert muting rule as a Unix timestamp, in seconds

negated.description: (false by default) whether this filter should be a "not" filter

property_value.description: the value of the property to filter by

block.description: list of alert muting filters for this rule

external_id.description: The SignalFx-generated AWS external ID to use with an AWS integration.

signalfx_aws_account.description: The SignalFx AWS account ID to use with an AWS role.

auth_method.description: The mechanism used to authenticate with AWS.

custom_cloudwatch_namespaces.description: List of custom AWS CloudWatch namespaces to monitor. Custom namespaces contain custom metrics that you define in AWS; SignalFx imports the metrics so you can monitor them.

enable_aws_usage.description: Flag that controls how SignalFx imports usage metrics from AWS to use with AWS Cost Optimizer. If `true`, SignalFx imports the metrics.

enable_check_large_volume.description: Controls how SignalFx checks for large amounts of data for this AWS integration. If true, SignalFx monitors the amount of data coming in from the integration.

enabled.description: Whether the integration is enabled or not

external_id.description: Used with `signalfx_aws_external_integration`. Use this property to specify the external id.

import_cloud_watch.description: Flag that controls how SignalFx imports Cloud Watch metrics. If true, SignalFx imports Cloud Watch metrics from AWS.

key.description: Used with `signalfx_aws_token_integration`. Use this property to specify the token.

named_token.description: A named token to use for ingest

poll_rate.description: AWS poll rate (in seconds). Between `60` and `300`.

regions.description: List of AWS regions that SignalFx should monitor.

role_arn.description: Used with `signalfx_aws_external_integration`. Use this property to specify the AIM role ARN.

services.description: List of AWS services that you want SignalFx to monitor. Each element is a string designating an AWS service.

token.description: Used with `signalfx_aws_token_integration`. Use this property to specify the token.

use_get_metric_data_method.description: Enables the use of Amazon's GetMetricData API. Defaults to `false`.

default_action.description: Controls the SignalFx default behavior for processing data from an AWS namespace. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

filter_action.description: Controls how SignalFx processes data from a custom AWS namespace. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

filter_source.description: Expression that selects the data that SignalFx should sync for the custom namespace associated with this sync rule. The expression uses the syntax defined for the SignalFlow `filter()` function; it can be any valid SignalFlow filter expression.

namespace.description: An AWS custom namespace having custom AWS metrics that you want to sync with SignalFx. See the AWS documentation on publishing metrics for more information.

block.description: Each element controls the data collected by SignalFx for the specified namespace. If you specify this property, SignalFx ignores values in the "custom_cloudwatch_namespaces" property.

default_action.description: Controls the SignalFx default behavior for processing data from an AWS namespace. SignalFx ignores this property unless you specify the "filter" property in the namespace sync rule. If you do specify a filter, use this property to control how SignalFx treats data that doesn't match the filter. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

filter_action.description: Controls how SignalFx processes data from a custom AWS namespace. The available actions are one of "Include" or "Exclude".

filter_source.description: Expression that selects the data that SignalFx should sync for the custom namespace associated with this sync rule. The expression uses the syntax defined for the SignalFlow `filter()` function; it can be any valid SignalFlow filter expression.

namespace.description: An AWS namespace having custom AWS metrics that you want to sync with SignalFx. See the AWS documentation on publishing metrics for more information.

block.description: Each element in the array is an object that contains an AWS namespace name and a filter that controls the data that SignalFx collects for the namespace. If you specify this property, SignalFx ignores the values in the AWS CloudWatch Integration Model "services" property. If you don't specify either property, SignalFx syncs all data in all AWS namespaces.

signalfx_aws_account.description: The SignalFx AWS account ID to use with an AWS role.

token_id.description: The SignalFx-generated AWS token to use with an AWS integration.

app_id.description: Azure application ID for the SignalFx app.

enabled.description: Whether the integration is enabled or not

environment.description: what type of Azure integration this is. The allowed values are `"azure_us_government"` and `"azure"`. Defaults to `"azure"`

named_token.description: A named token to use for ingest

poll_rate.description: Azure poll rate (in seconds). One of `60` or `300`.

secret_key.description: Azure secret key that associates the SignalFx app in Azure with the Azure tenant.

services.description: List of Microsoft Azure service names for the Azure services you want SignalFx to monitor. SignalFx only supports certain services, and if you specify an unsupported one, you receive an API error.

subscriptions.description: List of Azure subscriptions that SignalFx should monitor.

sync_guest_os_namespaces.description: If enabled, SignalFx will try to sync additional namespaces for VMs (including VMs in scale sets): telegraf/mem, telegraf/cpu, azure.vm.windows.guest (these are namespaces recommended by Azure when enabling their Diagnostic Extension). If there are no metrics there, no new datapoints will be ingested.

tenant_id.description: Azure ID of the Azure tenant.

block.description: Allows for more fine-grained control of syncing of custom namespaces, should the boolean convenience parameter `sync_guest_os_namespaces` be not enough. The customer may specify a map of services to custom namespaces. If they do so, for each service which is a key in this map, we will attempt to sync metrics from namespaces in the value list in addition to the default namespaces.

authorized_writer_teams.description: Team IDs that have write access to this dashboard

authorized_writer_users.description: User IDs that have write access to this dashboard

charts_resolution.description: Specifies the chart data display resolution for charts in this dashboard. Value can be one of "default", "low", "high", or "highest". default by default

dashboard_group.description: The ID of the dashboard group that contains the dashboard. If an ID is not provided during creation, the dashboard will be placed in a newly created dashboard group

end_time.description: Seconds since epoch to end the visualization

start_time.description: Seconds since epoch to start the visualization

time_range.description: From when to display data. SignalFx time syntax (e.g. -5m, -1h)

chart_id.description: ID of the chart to display

column.description: The column to show the chart in (zero-based); this value always represents the leftmost column of the chart. (between 0 and 11)

height.description: How many rows the chart should take up. (greater than or equal to 1)

row.description: The row to show the chart in (zero-based); if height > 1, this value represents the topmost row of the chart. (greater than or equal to 0)

width.description: How many columns (out of a total of 12, one-based) the chart should take up. (between 1 and 12)

block.description: Chart ID and layout information for the charts in the dashboard

chart_ids.description: Charts to use for the column

column.description: The column to show the chart in (zero-based); this value always represents the leftmost column of the chart. (between 0 and 11)

height.description: How many rows each chart should take up. (greater than or equal to 1)

width.description: Number of columns (out of a total of 12) each chart should take up. (between 1 and 12)

block.description: Column layout. Charts listed, will be placed in a single column with the same width and height

label.description: The text displaying in the dropdown menu used to select this event overlay as an active overlay for the dashboard.

line.description: (false by default) Whether a vertical line should be displayed in the plot at the time the event occurs

signal.description: Search term used to define events

type.description: Source for this event's data. Can be "eventTimeSeries" (default) or "detectorEvents".

negated.description: (false by default) Whether this filter should be a "not" filter

property.description: A metric time series dimension or property name

values.description: List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

block.description: Event overlay to add to charts

apply_if_exist.description: If true, this filter will also match data that does not have the specified property

negated.description: (false by default) Whether this filter should be a "not" filter

property.description: A metric time series dimension or property name

values.description: List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

block.description: Filter to apply to each chart in the dashboard

chart_ids.description: Charts to use for the grid

height.description: How many rows each chart should take up. (greater than or equal to 1)

width.description: Number of columns (out of a total of 12, one-based) each chart should take up. (between 1 and 12)

block.description: Grid dashboard layout. Charts listed will be placed in a grid by row with the same width and height. If a chart can't fit in a row, it will be placed automatically in the next row

signal.description: Search term used to define events

type.description: Source for this event's data. Can be "eventTimeSeries" (default) or "detectorEvents".

negated.description: (false by default) Whether this filter should be a "not" filter

property.description: A metric time series dimension or property name

values.description: List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

block.description: Event overlay added to charts by default to charts

alias.description: An alias for the dashboard variable. This text will appear as the label for the dropdown field on the dashboard

apply_if_exist.description: If true, this variable will also match data that does not have the specified property

property.description: A metric time series dimension or property name

replace_only.description: If true, this variable will only apply to charts with a filter on the named property.

restricted_suggestions.description: If true, this variable may only be set to the values listed in preferredSuggestions. and only these values will appear in autosuggestion menus. false by default

value_required.description: Determines whether a value is required for this variable (and therefore whether it will be possible to view this dashboard without this filter applied). false by default

values.description: List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

values_suggested.description: A list of strings of suggested values for this variable; these suggestions will receive priority when values are autosuggested for this variable

block.description: Dashboard variable to apply to each chart in the dashboard

authorized_writer_teams.description: Team IDs that have write access to this dashboard

authorized_writer_users.description: User IDs that have write access to this dashboard

dashboard_id.description: The label used in the publish statement that displays the plot (metric time series data) you want to customize

description_override.description: String that provides a description override for a mirrored dashboard

name_override.description: String that provides a name override for a mirrored dashboard

negated.description: (false by default) Whether this filter should be a "not" filter

property.description: A metric time series dimension or property name

values.description: List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

block.description: Filter to apply to each chart in the dashboard

property.description: A metric time series dimension or property name

values.description: List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

values_suggested.description: A list of strings of suggested values for this variable; these suggestions will receive priority when values are autosuggested for this variable

block.description: Dashboard variable to apply to each chart in the dashboard
Dashboard IDs that are members of this dashboard group. Also handles 'mirrored' dashboards.

negated.description: (false by default) Whether this filter should be a "not" filter

property.description: A metric time series dimension or property name

values.description: List of strings (which will be treated as an OR filter on the property)

block.description: Filter to apply to each chart in the dashboard

context_dashboard_id.description: The dashobard ID to which this data link will be applied

property_name.description: Name (key) of the metadata that's the trigger of a data link. If you specify `property_value`, you must specify `property_name`.

property_value.description: Value of the metadata that's the trigger of a data link. If you specify this property, you must also specify `property_name`.

is_default.description: Flag that designates a target as the default for a data link object.

minimum_time_window.description: The minimum time window for a search sent to an external site. Depends on the value set for `time_format`.

name.description: User-assigned target name. Use this value to differentiate between the link targets for a data link object.

property_key_mapping.description: Describes the relationship between SignalFx metadata keys and external system properties when the key names are different

time_format.description: Designates the format of minimumTimeWindow in the same data link target object.

url.description: URL string for a Splunk instance or external system data link target.

block.description: Link to an external URL

dashboard_group_id.description: SignalFx-assigned ID of the dashboard link target's dashboard group

dashboard_id.description: SignalFx-assigned ID of the dashboard link target

is_default.description: Flag that designates a target as the default for a data link object.

name.description: User-assigned target name. Use this value to differentiate between the link targets for a data link object.

block.description: Link to a SignalFx dashboard

is_default.description: Flag that designates a target as the default for a data link object.

name.description: User-assigned target name. Use this value to differentiate between the link targets for a data link object.

property_key_mapping.description: Describes the relationship between SignalFx metadata keys and external system properties when the key names are different

block.description: Link to a Splunk instance

authorized_writer_teams.description: Team IDs that have write access to this dashboard

authorized_writer_users.description: User IDs that have write access to this dashboard

disable_sampling.description: (false by default) When false, samples a subset of the output MTS in the visualization.

end_time.description: Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization

max_delay.description: How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints. Max value 900 (15m)

program_text.description: Signalflow program text for the detector. More info at "https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview"

show_data_markers.description: (true by default) When true, markers will be drawn for each datapoint within the visualization.

show_event_lines.description: (false by default) When true, vertical lines will be drawn for each triggered event within the visualization.

start_time.description: Seconds since epoch. Used for visualization

time_range.description: Seconds to display in the visualization. This is a rolling range from the current time. Example: 3600 = `-1h`. Defaults to 3600

detect_label.description: A detect label which matches a detect label within the program text

disabled.description: (default: false) When true, notifications and events will not be generated for the detect label

notifications.description: List of strings specifying where notifications will be sent when an incident occurs. See https://developers.signalfx.com/v2/docs/detector-model#notifications-models for more info

parameterized_body.description: Custom notification message body when an alert is triggered. See https://developers.signalfx.com/v2/reference#detector-model for more info

parameterized_subject.description: Custom notification message subject when an alert is triggered. See https://d    evelopers.signalfx.com/v2/reference#detector-model for more info

runbook_url.description: URL of page to consult when an alert is triggered

severity.description: The severity of the rule, must be one of: Critical, Warning, Major, Minor, Info

tip.description: Plain text suggested first course of action, such as a command to execute.

block.description: Set of rules used for alerting

display_name.description: Specifies an alternate value for the Plot Name column of the Data Table associated with the chart.

label.description: The label used in the publish statement that displays the plot (metric time series data) you want to customize

value_prefix.description: An arbitrary prefix to display with the value of this plot

value_suffix.description: An arbitrary suffix to display with the value of this plot

value_unit.description: A unit to attach to this plot. Units support automatic scaling (eg thousands of bytes will be displayed as kilobytes)

block.description: Plot-level customization options, associated with a publish statement

end_time.description: Seconds since epoch to end the visualization

program_text.description: Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at "https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview"

start_time.description: Seconds since epoch to start the visualization

time_range.description: Seconds to display in the visualization. This is a rolling range from the current time. Example: 3600 = `-1h`

enabled.description: Whether the integration is enabled or not

named_token.description: A named token to use for ingest

block.description: GCP project service keys

disable_sampling.description: (false by default) If false, samples a subset of the output MTS, which improves UI performance

group_by.description: Properties to group by in the heatmap (in nesting order)

hide_timestamp.description: (false by default) Whether to show the timestamp in the chart

max_delay.description: How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints

minimum_resolution.description: The minimum resolution (in seconds) to use for computing the underlying program

program_text.description: Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at "https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview"

refresh_interval.description: How often (in seconds) to refresh the values of the heatmap

sort_by.description: The property to use when sorting the elements. Must be prepended with + for ascending or - for descending (e.g. -foo)

color.description: The color range to use. The starting hex color value for data values in a heatmap chart. Specify the value as a 6-character hexadecimal value preceded by the '#' character, for example "#ea1849" (grass green).

max_value.description: The maximum value within the coloring range

min_value.description: The minimum value within the coloring range

block.description: Values and color for the color range. Example: colorRange : { min : 0, max : 100, color : "#0000ff" }

color.description: The color to use. Must be one of gray, blue, light_blue, navy, dark_orange, orange, dark_yellow, magenta, cerise, pink, violet, purple, gray_blue, dark_green, green, aquamarine, red, yellow, vivid_yellow, light_green, or lime_green.

gt.description: Indicates the lower threshold non-inclusive value for this range

gte.description: Indicates the lower threshold inclusive value for this range

lt.description: Indicates the upper threshold non-inculsive value for this range

lte.description: Indicates the upper threshold inclusive value for this range

block.description: Single color range including both the color to display for that range and the borders of the range

api_token.description: The API token for the user email

assignee_display_name.description: Jira display name for the assignee

assignee_name.description: Jira user name for the assignee

auth_method.description: Authentication method used when creating the Jira integration. One of `EmailAndToken` or `UsernameAndPassword`

base_url.description: Base URL of the Jira instance that's integrated with SignalFx.

enabled.description: Whether the integration is enabled or not

issue_type.description: Issue type (for example, Story) for tickets that Jira creates for detector notifications. SignalFx validates issue types, so you must specify a type that's valid for the Jira project specified in `projectKey`.

password.description: Password used to authenticate the Jira integration.

project_key.description: Jira key of an existing project. When Jira creates a new ticket for a detector notification, the ticket is assigned to this project.

user_email.description: Email address used to authenticate the Jira integration.

username.description: User name used to authenticate the Jira integration.

disable_sampling.description: (false by default) If false, samples a subset of the output MTS, which improves UI performance

end_time.description: Seconds since epoch to end the visualization

legend_fields_to_hide.description: List of properties that shouldn't be displayed in the chart legend (i.e. dimension names)

max_delay.description: How long (in seconds) to wait for late datapoints

max_precision.description: Maximum number of digits to display when rounding values up or down

program_text.description: Signalflow program text for the chart. More info at "https://developers.signalfx.com/docs/signalflow-overview"

refresh_interval.description: How often (in seconds) to refresh the values of the list

secondary_visualization.description: (false by default) What kind of secondary visualization to show (None, Radial, Linear, Sparkline)

sort_by.description: The property to use when sorting the elements. Use 'value' if you want to sort by value. Must be prepended with + for ascending or - for descending (e.g. -foo)

start_time.description: Seconds since epoch to start the visualization

time_range.description: Seconds to display in the visualization. This is a rolling range from the current time. Example: 3600 = `-1h`

color.description: The color to use. Must be one of gray, blue, light_blue, navy, dark_orange, orange, dark_yellow, magenta, cerise, pink, violet, purple, gray_blue, dark_green, green, aquamarine, red, yellow, vivid_yellow, light_green, or lime_green.

gt.description: Indicates the lower threshold non-inclusive value for this range

gte.description: Indicates the lower threshold inclusive value for this range

lt.description: Indicates the upper threshold non-inculsive value for this range

lte.description: Indicates the upper threshold inclusive value for this range

property.description: The name of a property to hide or show in the data table.

block.description: List of property and enabled flags to control the order and presence of datatable labels in a chart.

enabled.description: Whether the integration is enabled or not

disabled.description: Flag that controls enabling the token. If set to `true`, the token is disabled, and you can't use it for authentication. Defaults to `false`

notifications.description: List of strings specifying where notifications will be sent when an incident occurs. See https://developers.signalfx.com/v2/docs/detector-model#notifications-models for more info

dpm_limit.description: The datapoints per minute (dpm) limit for this token. If you exceed this limit, SignalFx sends out an alert.

dpm_notification_threshold.description: DPM level at which SignalFx sends the notification for this token. If you don't specify a notification, SignalFx sends the generic notification.

container_limit.description: Max number of containers that can use this token

custom_metrics_limit.description: Max number of custom metrics that can be sent with this token

high_res_metrics_limit.description: Max number of high-res metrics that can be sent with this token

host_limit.description: Max number of hosts that can use this token

enabled.description: Whether the integration is enabled or not

color_by.description: (Metric by default) Must be "Metric", "Dimension", or "Scale". "Scale" maps to Color by Value in the UI

is_timestamp_hidden.description: (false by default) Whether to hide the timestamp in the chart

max_precision.description: The maximum precision to for values displayed in the list

axes_precision.description: Force a specific number of significant digits in the y-axis

stacked.description: (false by default) Whether area and bar charts in the visualization should be stacked
